topic.title: Zeronet Faq Missing android Tor Instructions
topic.body: The zeronet faq is missing tor Instructions for andoid. It's not a big deal though because these instructions exist elsewhere.

1537072984_15emDktbvC4dppRCwuph3Q3qCBsyd.body:
If I add the following to lines to torrc in orbit:
ControlPort 9051
CookieAuthentication 1

I get the error:
Status: Error ([Errno 13] Permission denied: '/data/data/org.torproject.android/app_data/control_auth_cookie')

If I also add the following:
DataDirectoryGroupReadable 1 
CookieAuthFileGroupReadable 1 
ExtORPortCookieAuthFileGroupReadable 1 
CacheDirectoryGroupReadable 1

See:
http://murga-linux.com/puppy/viewtopic.php?p=1004589#1004589

Tor doesn't even start. I thought the issue might be due to other aps not being able to read orbits data folder so I tried modifying the cookie location 

CookieAuthFile /mnt/sdcard/control_auth_cookie

and giving both orbit and zeronet permission to access internal storage but that didn't help. I think I'll need to root my phone and give zeronet super user premission for this to work. I won't be doing that on this device though since it is still under warranty.

Not that using tor as a proxy for the trackers works on my android and I could also proxy all connections through tor If I wanted.

I also tried the following path for the cookie path:
/storage/emulated/0/Download/orbit/control_auth_cookie

See:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46610819/how-to-get-absolute-path-of-internal-storage-in-android

I created the folder orbit using the built in file explorer and verified the path using termux.
